document_content.title: Referral to Internal Medicine for Further Evaluation

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Jensen presents with persistent fatigue, intermittent low-grade fever, and unexplained weight loss over the past two months. Basic laboratory workup has shown mild anemia and elevated inflammatory markers.

sections.heading: Medical History
sections.content: No significant past medical history. No known drug allergies. No previous surgeries. Family history notable for autoimmune conditions.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: On physical examination, the patient appears pale and mildly fatigued. No lymphadenopathy or hepatosplenomegaly detected. Cardiovascular and respiratory examinations are unremarkable.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Recent laboratory tests: Hemoglobin 10.2 g/dL, ESR 45 mm/hr, CRP 18 mg/L. Renal and liver function tests within normal limits. Chest X-ray unremarkable.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the unexplained constitutional symptoms and laboratory findings, further evaluation by Internal Medicine is requested to investigate possible underlying causes such as autoimmune disorders, chronic infections, or hematologic conditions.
